review: We enjoy the Amazon Prime Instant video, and have used it through our Wii in the past. I thought this would simplify the task for my wife, but it just turned into a headache as the unit wouldn't turn on, I would replace the batteries in the remote, it would work for two days, then not turn on the next time. Frustrating. I'll return this and we will go back to using the Wii which is always reliable if not easy.
author: Craig A DeLoughery

review: I LOVE the Amazon Fire TV. It does exactly what I needed it for. It's small and doesn't take up a lot of room. It's easy to use. It's been a great investment.
author: KKCPJ

review: So easy to use, and a wonderful interface to open up the internet and movie databases to your TV.
author: Ryan in Atlanta

review: We've never had anything like this before. We're not techie at all. It just doesn't matter with the Amazon Fire TV.  Instructions are clear; we luckily already had the required cable; set-up was easy; we're enjoying our free month of Netflix.  The only problem we have had is not telling our son we have the Fire TV before Christmas--he gave us another brand (Roku).For folks who are used to streaming to any type of device, the ease of the Fire TV may not be a big deal; but aging Baby Boomers should love it!
author: Cindi

review: Easy to setup and use. The voice search feature is soooo much better than the typical hunt and peck entry.
author: ANTHONY F DIFRANCO

review: I love my Amazon Fire Tv. I got rid of Dish and got an antenna for my local channels. I don't miss the high bills from Dish and Cable TV. The only thing I slightly miss is HLN live. And that is slightly. I stream Netfix and use Amazon Prime. I'm happy with my purchase.
